Entropica QAOA
  • Docs »
  • Welcome to EntropicaQAOA’s documentation!
  • View page source

Welcome to EntropicaQAOA’s documentation!¶

EntropicaQAOA is a modular QAOA package built on top of Rigetti’s Forest SDK. It enables users to quickly run their own QAOA instances and easily replace any component with their own custom code.

Features¶

  • Full native support for Rigetti’s QVM and QPUs. Run your experiments on real Quantum Computers!

  • Extensive examples explaining the usage of EntropicaQAOA in detail.

  • Multiple parametrisations for QAOA.

  • NetworkX integration for the treatment of graph theoretic problems, and Pandas integration for data importing.

  • Modular code base that allows the user to customise and modify different components.

Installation¶

If you don’t have them already, install first Rigetti’s pyQquil package and their QVM and Quil Compiler. For instructions on how to do so, see the Rigetti documentation here.

In a Python3.6+ virtual environment you can install the entropica_qaoa package using pip

pip install entropica_qaoa

and if you have it already installed upgraded via

pip install --upgrade entropica_qaoa

If you want to run the Demo Notebooks, you will additionally need scikit-learn and scikit-optimize, which can also be installed using pip:

pip install scikit-learn && pip install scikit-optimize

First Steps¶

In First steps: An example workflow we show you the basic usage of EntropicaQAOA. More advanced examples on working with different parametrizations are found in Working with the Parameter classes, and the more advanced features of the cost functions are explained in Cost function features and VQE. To learn how to conveniently create QAOA problem instances, and convert between different formats, refer to Utility functions for QAOA.

The documentation can also downloaded as Jupyter notebooks from our GitHub page .
